subject: Science
title: Subduction Zones
description: A short lesson to help you apply Subduction Zones.

hook.text: When an ocean plate meets a continental plate, one dives beneath the other.

buildup.text: The denser ocean plate sinks into the mantle in a process called subduction.

discovery.text: As it sinks, water lowers the melting point of surrounding rock, creating magma.

twist.text: That magma rises to the surface â€” forming chains of volcanoes above the sinking plate.

climax.text: The Pacific Ring of Fire is one giant subduction zone circling the ocean.

punchline.text: One plate dives, melts, and erupts. That's the Ring of Fire recipe.

quiz.question: What happens at a subduction zone?
options: Two plates slide past each other
